help.info: Test if a polyhedron is close along a facet to another polyhedron.
help.descr:
Return true if the polyhedron P is close to polyhedron Q along any facet. Both polyhedrons must be in H-representation. If they are not, the irredundant H-representation will be computed.
The function tests if polyhedra P and S are close to each other along any facet by the following test. For each of the facets, compute its the Chebyshev centre, and generate a point outside of the set P that is close to the Chebyshev center. If the polyhedron Q contains this point, it is considered as neighbor, otherwise not.
Note: This is experimental code.

input.name: fP
input.descr: Index of a facet to test from polyhedron P.

input.name: fQ
input.descr: Index of a facet to test from polyhedron Q.

output.name: ts
output.descr: Logical statement if the polyhedron P is close to Q along the facet.

output.name: iP
output.descr: Index of a facet from polyhedron P that is closest to the polyhedron Q.

output.name: iQ
output.descr: Index of a facet from polyhedron Q that is closest to the polyhedron P.
